name: Contemporary 2BR in Financial District by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the bright, open-concept living space, modern decor, and fully-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Located in the Financial District, steps away from the waterfront.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the bright, open-concept living space, modern decor, and fully-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Located in the Financial District, steps away from the waterfront. Although mostly frequented by professionals, Boston’s Financial District offers beautiful historic sites and delicious restaurants for anyone to enjoy. Experience American history up close and personal and head out to the Freedom Trail, a 2.5 mile, self-guided tour that leads you through iconic landmarks that represent some of the nation’s more formative years. One of the stops along this tour leads you to Faneuil Hall, where America’s original pushcart shopping began. Offering more than just hand-crafted souvenirs, this marketplace hosts world-class street performers and eclectic boutiques. Once you’ve worked up enough an appetite, you must indulge at Cafe Fleuri’s one-of-a-kind Chocolate Bar buffet; the cuisine is American, but the experience is out of this world. This Sonder doe
neighborhood_overview: Although mostly frequented by professionals, Boston’s Financial District offers beautiful historic sites and delicious restaurants for anyone to enjoy. Experience American history up close and personal and head out to the Freedom Trail, a 2.5 mile, self-guided tour that leads you through iconic landmarks that represent some of the nation’s more formative years. One of the stops along this tour leads you to Faneuil Hall, where America’s original pushcart shopping began. Offering more than just hand-crafted souvenirs, this marketplace hosts world-class street performers and eclectic boutiques. Once you’ve worked up enough an appetite, you must indulge at Cafe Fleuri’s one-of-a-kind Chocolate Bar buffet; the cuisine is American, but the experience is out of this world.
notes: This Sonder does not have air conditioning, but we'll provide fans for each of the rooms that you can use during your stay.
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I

name: Lovely Studio in the Heart of the Theatre District
summary: This spacious efficiency suite is a great option for people looking to be in the middle of the City at a price that won't break the budget! This unit was recently re-furnished and can accommodate up to 2 people via the queen bed. There is a full kitchen for those who want to prepare their own meals. The location is ideal for getting around Boston without a car as most neighborhoods are accesible on foot and there are a number of T stations within a few minutes walk.
space: This studio is on the 5th floor of the building,  accessible by elevator or stairs. The spacious living area is furnished with a queen-size bed to comfortably sleep up to 2 guests. The flooring is hardwood throughout with ceramic tile in the bathroom. This unit has central heating and cooling that is controlled via a shared thermostat in the hallway. Connect to the HD Smart TV to stream the programming of your choice or watch local channels available over the antenna. All units are equipped with wireless internet, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, linens and towels, and we provide a digital guest book with instructions and recommendations for the area. This is the perfect location for business travelers, couples or families who want to stay in Downtown Boston without breaking the budget.

neighborhood_overview: The central nature of this property makes it ideal for traveling or relocating professionals, students and faculty at local universities, or short term and extended stay guests looking for the perfect starting point from which to explore the City of Boston.
notes: The closest parking garages are the Boston Common Garage located at 0 Charles Street, and the Summer Street Garage located at 22 Kingston Street (This is the entrance). Daily rates range from $32-$42, with monthly rates starting $150 (with restricted weekday access)
transit: The Boston Common Park and Public Garden are only a few hundred feet away and Fenway Park is a quick 15 minutes away by train. Public transit by way of the Red, Orange and Green Subway lines is only a minute walk from the property. Grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minute walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Tufts Medical, Boston University, Emerson College and many other hospitals and schools are within 5-30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit.
access: This unit is accessed by riding the elevator to the 5th floor. There is a coin-operated common laundry room located on the 5th floor of the building that is available for guest use.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay in a way that requires little to no interaction with us, unless of course you have an emergency, maintenance or management request in which case you will be provided contact information.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

Two days prior to your arrival, you will receive a pre-stay email directly from us that includes your room number, access codes, and other important information.  The closest parking garages are the Boston Common Garage located at 0 Charles Street, and the Summer Street Garage located at 22 Kingston Street (This is the entrance). Daily rates range from $32-$42, with monthly rates starting $150 (with restricted weekday access)
transit: The Boston Common Park and Public Garden are only a few hundred feet away and Fenway Park is a quick 15 minutes away by train. Public transit by way of the Red, Orange and Green Subway lines is only a minute walk from the property. Grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minute walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Tufts Medical, Boston University, Emerson College and many other hospitals and schools are within 5-30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit.
access: This unit is accessed by riding the elevator to the 5th floor. There is a coin-operated common laundry room located on the 5th floor of the building that is available for guest use.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay in a way that requires little to no interaction with us, unless of course you have an emergency, maintenance or management request in which case you will be provided contact information.

name: Quaint & Cozy Downtown Crossing Studio A+ Location
summary: This spacious efficiency suite is a great option for people looking to be in the middle of the City at a price that won't break the budget! This unit was recently re-furnished and can accommodate up to 4 people via the Full over Queen bunk bed. There is an in-unit kitchenette for those who want to prepare their own meals. The location is ideal for getting around Boston without a car as most neighborhoods are accesible on foot and there are a number of T stations within a few minutes walk.
space: This studio is on the 6th floor of the building,  accessible by elevator or stairs to the 5th floor and one flight of stairs to the sixth floor (there is no elevator access to the 6th floor). The spacious living area is furnished with a full over queen-size bunk bed to comfortably sleep up to 4 guests. The flooring is carpeted throughout with ceramic tile in the bathroom. Relax on the loveseat and connect to the HD Smart TV to stream the programming of your choice or watch local channels available over the antenna. All units are equipped with wireless internet, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, hotplate burner, linens and towels, and we provide a digital guest book with instructions and recommendations for the area. This is the perfect location for business travelers, couples or families who want to stay in Downtown Boston without breaking the budget.

house_rules: - You agree to the following: -  - CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing  - KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB - BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you  - QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must
host_about:
We are a passionate team running a modern tech-enabled corp housing co that believes nicely furnished high end homes should be consistent, affordable and easy to book. 

All our homes are professionally managed, meeting the mark on being clean, well-stocked, having a more or less consistent look and feel, priced below a comparable hotel for an extended stay, and 24/7 SMS support by a virtual concierge team.

name: Beautiful Huge Studio in Theatre District
summary: Beautiful Studio Apartment in Theatre District next to Downtown crossing. The Studio apartment is located in right by commons and it overlooks on the park. It is very big and has lots of space.  The Studio Apartment is walking distance to the train station, Boston Opera House, Theaters, Museums, NewBurry St, Seaport district, and many other places.  Please contact us if you have any questions or concerns. We are more than happy to assist.
space: The Studio has a King Size bed, small Sofa, an Air mattress as well as a folded bed. name: Gorgeous Downtown Loft One Block to Boston Common
summary: Bright and spacious loft in the heart of downtown with enviable city views. This modern loft is in the city's most central location - just steps to the Boston Common, Freedom Trail, Financial District and historic Beacon Hill.  We are located in a walker's paradise and close to all subway lines, with a Walk Score of 99 and a Transit Score of 100.
space: 1,000 square feet (90 meters) of work and living space, with a queen bed, 100% cotton linens, luxury down-filled sofa, smart TV, extremely fast 200 MBps WiFi, and in-unit laundry.  The kitchen is fully stocked with olive oil, salt, pepper, coffee, tea, and sugar. Our bathroom offers high-end shampoo, conditioner, body wash and single-use spa slippers. In addition to the master bedroom, there is a sofa bed with a plush mattress topper that comfortably sleeps up to two kids or smaller adults. The entire apartment is professionally cleaned between guests.
description: Bright and spacious loft in the heart of downtown with enviable city views. This modern loft is in the city's most central location - just steps to the Boston Common, Freedom Trail, Financial District and historic Beacon Hill.  We are located in a walker's paradise and close to all subway lines, with a Walk Score of 99 and a Transit Score of (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) square feet (90 meters) of work and living space, with a queen bed, 100% cotton linens, luxury down-filled sofa, smart TV, extremely fast 200 MBps WiFi, and in-unit laundry.  The kitchen is fully stocked with olive oil, salt, pepper, coffee, tea, and sugar. Our bathroom offers high-end shampoo, conditioner, body wash and single-use spa slippers. In addition to the master bedroom, there is a sofa bed with a plush mattress topper that comfortably sleeps up to two kids or smaller adults. The entire apartment is professionally cleaned between guests. We provide easy self check-in and we're always available for questions
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located on a lively pedestrian street in downtown Boston, we are in the middle of the city's historic sites, restaurants, and shopping.  The neighborhood offers quick healthy eats, coffeeshops and some of Boston's best reviewed bars and restaurants. The apartment is also directly across the street from Roche Brothers, downtown's only supermarket, and next to a subway stop.
notes: City taxis are allowed on our pedestrian street, but Ubers will pick up and drop off on the corner -- a 1 minute walk from our front door. During the day you might hear street musicians playing below.
transit: The Downtown Crossing subway station is next to the building (Red and Orange lines). The Park Street station is one block away (Green line). South Station is a 6 minute walk (Amtrak and buses).
interaction: We provide easy self check-in and we're always available for questions or recommendations.
house_rules: - Please leave all dishes clean.  Dirty dishes and leftover food will incur an extra cleaning fee.  - Stained towels and linens (for example from makeup or spray tans) will be charged to the guest. - Quiet after 10 PM to respect our neighbors. - All bookings require a security deposit of $400. You will not be charged for this in advance. - We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $400 fine. - Hosting a party or event in our home without prior approval or bringing guests greater than the number stated in your reservation will result in a $400 fine.  Special daytime events can be arranged with prior permission. - We do not accept guests from the Greater Boston area without prior approval.
host_about: Digital nomad by way of Boston.  I invest in early stage technology companies and travel full-time to explore startup and innovation ecosystems around the world.  I look forward to meeting you!

name: (M2A) Spacious Downtown Living!
summary: "The Financial District is downtown’s business nerve center, crowded with stately banks, high-rise offices and sleek condos. Post Office Square, home to Norman B. Leventhal Park, offers a green respite with a lawn, sculptural fountain and garden trellises. Suited professionals frequent the district's chain eateries, lunch spots and high-end coffee shops. Swanky lounges and boisterous Irish pubs draw after-work crowds."
space: This is a beautiful 2 bedroom in the Financial District of Boston. This unit has hardwood throughout with a very open floor plan making it feel much bigger.This unit has a nice master bedroom with a King mattress and another bedroom with a queen mattress, both with spectacular views of the city and large windows for natural light..

name: Posh Boston 1-BR Apt Near Boston Common!
summary: Conveniently located between Bostons Financial District and Theater District, these apartments are within walking distance from all historic landmarks, shops, and dining venues in Downtown Crossing. Superior amenities like a 25-yard indoor pool, a plush clubhouse distinguish this upscale high-rise. Oversized windows overlooking Boston skyline, hardwood floors, and chef-caliber kitchens with granite counter tops & stainless steel appliances are only a few of the features of these wonderful homes
space: 1 Bed, 1 Bath, Sleeps 3 Located right in the heart of Boston, overlooking the beautiful skyline, the builsing’s newly constructed, fully furnished, luxury apartments are beyond compare. Whether you are looking for a relaxing swim in the 25-yard indoor infinity pool or attending to business in the Internet Café, these apartments have it all. On top of the five-star amenities inside the building, walk right outside and experience true Bostonian city life. Downtown Crossing is home to the historical Freedom Trail, over 100 restaurants, 500 retailers, bars, nightclubs, and different cultural events. Planning to explore Boston or beyond? This fantastic location is just steps from the Orange and Green T-stops, South Station Terminal, I-90, and Logan International Airport. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and concierge service, parking garage, as well as unparalleled on-site amenities makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

name: Quaint Theater District 1BR w/ Indoor Pool + Gym by Blueground

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Boston’s Theatre District/Chinatown. Home to the Boston Opera House, the Citi Performing Arts Center, and the Charles Playhouse, there are exciting productions for all ages. People often associate the Theatre District and Chinatown as one neighborhood because of their close proximity. The area offers an extensive selection of Asian restaurants and bakeries. Take a stroll through the appealing alleys to discover herbal shops and vibrant markets. During the Chinese New Year and August Moon Festivals, the streets are filled with dancing dragons, traditional music and martial arts demonstrations. Locals love to flock to this unique cultural hub, as there is always something to see.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Stylish Boston Common | Theater District Apartment
summary: Our beautiful apartment is located across the street from historic Boston Common. Witness the beautiful views of the Boston Common from our living room windows! Emerson College is only steps from our front door. Grab some dinner, sightsee, & shop at Newbury St, Downtown Crossing, Theater District, Chinatown or North End; all located within a 3-10 minute walk. Catch a Broadway show at the Wang Theatre, only a 5 minute walk or an Opera performance at the Boston Opera House, just a 7 minute walk.
space: Located in the heart of Downtown Boston, our spacious 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment is the perfect place for friends, couples, professionals, families and groups up to 4 people. The open concept living room and kitchen boasts high ceilings and large windows with a stunning view of the Boston Common. The living room is furnished with a large comfy sofa and a beautiful accent chair. The sofa can be slept on comfortably. We also provide a queen size air mattress with linens. We have a flat screen HD TV with full cable and Netflix. There is a dining table for 2 located next to the kitchen and bar seating for 4 at the kitchen counter. The kitchen is fully equipped with a refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, tea kettle and coffee maker. Coffee, creamers, sugar and an array of delicious teas are always provided! There are also pots, pans and all the amenities needed to cook. There is one full bathroom and we provide all essential toiletries including shampoo, conditioner and body wash

neighborhood_overview: We are located in between Downtown Crossing and Theater District. Downtown’s Theater District is full of energy in the evenings. Broadway hits, opera and dance are staged at a number of venues, including Emerson College’s ornate Cutler Majestic Theatre and the historic Boston Opera House. Comedy and music acts perform at the Wilbur. Low-key pubs, wine bars and modern bistros draw theatergoers and guests from nearby hotels. A few thumping nightclubs draw a stylish young crowd. Primarily a pedestrian shopping zone, Downtown Crossing lies at the intersection of Washington, Winter and Summer streets. Its historic buildings now house a mix of department stores, fashion and discount chains, souvenir shops and other specialty retailers. Street vendors selling food and knick-knacks and commuters from 2 subway stations add to the daytime hustle. Office workers frequent casual lunch spots and bars.
notes: Unfortunately, our street and most of the surrounding streets are resident/meter parking only. There are multiple parking garages located in the area. Prices vary depending on the day of the week, events, times etc. You can view their websites for more information on pricing. *CityPlace Garage - 8 Park Plaza - 3 minute walk *Boston Common Garage - Zero Charles St - 6 minute walk -we have a queen size air mattress and provide all linens and pillows.
transit: With a walk score of 98 and a transit score of 100, our neighborhood is considered a walkers and riders paradise! Another excellent way to explore the city is with the BLUEbike Program. The BLUEbike has stations throughout the Boston area. The closest station to our apartment is only a 3 minute walk at Charles St and Park Plaza Station. Other stations are located throughout the city. Locations can be downloaded to your smart-phone. Join online and enjoy the city by bicycle! It's a great way to get around the city! Below is a list of the closest Subway stations: Closet Subway Stations: * Boylston Station - Green Line Subway - 500 feet (3 minute walk) * Chinatown Station - Orange Line - 0.2 miles (5 minute walk) * Park St. Station - Red and Green Line Subway -0.3 miles - (7 minute walk) * Back Bay/South End Station -Amtrak and Commuter Rail - 0.5 miles (13 minute walk) Below is a list of tourist attractions, landmarks, universities, hospitals etc - * Freedom Trail Tours- 0.3 miles (7 min
access: During your stay, this is your home away from home! Guests have access to: the entire apartment, and the shared coin-operated washer and dryer in the basement of the building.
interaction: We live close by and are available by message and text. You can contact us if you have questions.
house_rules: -NO SMOKING inside of the apartment or anywhere in the building. Smoking allowed OUTSIDE ONLY. -THERE WILL BE A CHARGE OF $100 FROM THE SECURITY DEPOSIT FOR SMOKING INSIDE OF THE APARTMENT OR BUILDING. - Please be respectful to our neighbors. No loud parties or music.
host_about: I'm a 30 year old adventure-seeker, animal lover, and entrepreneur. I love to travel anywhere that has water, sand, mountains and a warm climate. I'm a city girl, but would rather sit on a quiet beach all day.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in the downtown Financial District. Naturally, downtown is the heart of Boston and the Financial District is near the North End, Government Center and Chinatown. The City Hall is located here, while a number of companies and agencies are headquartered in the area. You'll find pedestrian focused streets, large public green spaces, street performers, and countless historic sites all connected by an efficient public transit system. Shoppers can enjoy the Downtown Crossing shopping experience, offering easy walking access to Boston Common, the Seaport, Back Bay, the historic North End, the Theater District, and Chinatown. Downton Boston truly offers everything you could need, from Grocery to water taxis, all within walking distance.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Boston’s Theatre District/Chinatown. Home to the Boston Opera House, the Citi Performing Arts Center, and the Charles Playhouse, there are exciting productions for all ages. People often associate the Theatre District and Chinatown as one neighborhood because of their close proximity. The area offers an extensive selection of Asian restaurants and bakeries. Take a stroll through the appealing alleys to discover herbal shops and vibrant markets. During the Chinese New Year and August Moon Festivals, the streets are filled with dancing dragons, traditional music and martial arts demonstrations. Locals love to flock to this unique cultural hub, as there is always something to see.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in the downtown Financial District. Naturally, downtown is the heart of Boston and the Financial District is near the North End, Government Center and Chinatown. The City Hall is located here, while a number of companies and agencies are headquartered in the area. You'll find pedestrian focused streets, large public green spaces, street performers, and countless historic sites all connected by an efficient public transit system. Shoppers can enjoy the Downtown Crossing shopping experience, offering easy walking access to Boston Common, the Seaport, Back Bay, the historic North End, the Theater District, and Chinatown. Downton Boston truly offers everything you could need, from Grocery to water taxis, all within walking distance.

name: (S4) Hotel like Suite in Downtown Boston! BEST!
summary: The Financial District is downtown’s business nerve center, crowded with stately banks, high-rise offices and sleek condos. Post Office Square, home to Norman B. Leventhal Park, offers a green respite with a lawn, sculptural fountain and garden trellises. Suited professionals frequent the district's chain eateries, lunch spots and high-end coffee shops. Swanky lounges and boisterous Irish pubs draw after-work crowds.
space: This space is priced better than neighboring hotel rooms and have the added bonus of a suite like layout! The space is roughly 900 sq ft, direct elevator access to your unit, King size bed, comfortable couch with cable tv and high speed Wifi! The unit does not have a kitchen but it does provide a small fridge/freezer, electric kettle, kurig coffee maker, microwave, wine glasses, drinking glasses, coffee mugs, and silverware. Enjoy the comfort of a luxury suite for a lower price and the convenience of an Airbnb. This unit is spectacular! Great for short stays and business stays!

name: 503 A Great Place to Stay in Downtown Boston!
summary: Temple Place Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our efficiency micro-apartments. At just 150 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size, we are able to offer exceptional prices!  This unit features carpet throughout, there is a queen over XL full bed bunk bed, a separate wardrobe, and dresser for hanging and storing clothes, plus comfortable seating.  Limited kitchen inside the room!  Photos may be of similar listing!
space: A private bathroom and kitchenette with hot plate, efficiency size refrigerator, and basic cookware also included. Each floor has a full size oven/stove for more involved cooking or baking item, it's not in the room to save space! Dining table not included, many great restaurants nearby for you to enjoy!  There is a a queen over XL full bed bunk bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4!  This efficiency suite features a fully-equipped kitchenette and living area. The flooring is carpeted throughout, with ceramic tile in the bathroom. The bathroom has a beautiful, white tile enclosed shower. The kitchenette is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with a two burner hot plate for cooking meals. The flat screen HD Smart TV (making watching programs like Netflix a snap) is equipped with local channels and HDMI inputs that can be used to connect a computer to view online content. neighborhood_overview: The Boston Common Park and Public Garden are only a few hundred feet away and Fenway Park is a quick 15 minutes away by train. Public transit by way of the Red, Orange and Green Subway lines is only a minute walk from the property. Grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minute walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Tuft’s Medical, Boston University, Emerson College and many other hospitals and schools are within 5-30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass College of Pharmacy, Suffolk, MIT, Harvard, Tufts, Tufts Dental, and more!
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!
access: You'll receive high quality towels and linens, coffee, shampoo and conditioner, an iron, ironing board, and hair dryer.
interaction: Always available during the day via Airbnb and on the phone at night!
house_rules: House Rules You will be staying in a residential rental building with Airbnb guests and long term tenants so please abide by the following rules: -No smoking, smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside of the building.  -Please respect our neighbors by not having any additional guests.  -No parties, quiet hours begin at 9pm. -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the building. -Leave the room as you found it. -If you are a local, please do not instant book, contact us first. -Heat is controlled by the building so some rooms run warm!

name: 204 Downtown Boston Studio!
summary: Temple Place Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our high efficiency co-living, micro-apartments. At just 150 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices! *The bathroom and kitchen are both not private to the room.* This room features carpet throughout, a bunk bed with 2 queen beds, a separate wardrobe and dresser for hanging and storing clothes, plus comfortable seating. Photos may be of similar listing!
space: The bunk bed has a full size bed over queen size bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4!  For every two rooms offered to our guests, there is one unisex bathrooms. Only one person can be in the bathroom at a time so it's not exactly communal but definitely not private to just you.  The fully-functional common kitchen contains bar seating for up to 10 as well as a dining table and all necessary food prep and dining materials.  If you would like a room with a private bath, please contact us, additional rate will apply! This multi-unit residential space is situated above what was once the historic Windsor Button store. The space was last renovated in 2009. Located at 29-35 Temple Place in Downtown Crossing and in the heart of the Theatre District, guests here will find themselves within short walking distance to Boston’s Back Bay, Financial District, Chinatown and Beacon Hill. space: The room comes with a bunk bed that has a full size bed over queen size bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4! This efficiency suite features a fully-equipped kitchenette and living area. The flooring is carpeted throughout, with ceramic tile in the bathroom. This unit has central heating and cooling that is controlled via a thermostat in the unit. The bed area features a queen over full bed, full-sized desk, reading lamp and USB alarm clock. The bathroom has a beautiful, white tile enclosed shower. The flat screen HD Smart TV (making watching programs like Netflix a snap) is equipped with local channels and HDMI inputs that can be used to connect a computer to view online content. Full stove/oven located outside of the unit. name: 208 Room Near Boston Common Sleeps 3!
summary: Temple Place Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our high efficiency co-living, micro-apartments. At just 150 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices! *The bathroom and kitchen are both not private to the room.* This room features carpet throughout, a bunk bed with 2 queen beds, a separate wardrobe and dresser for hanging and storing clothes, plus comfortable seating. Photos may be of similar listing!
space: The bunk bed has a full size bed over queen size bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4!  For every two rooms offered to our guests, there is one unisex bathrooms. Only one person can be in the bathroom at a time so it's not exactly communal but definitely not private to just you.  The fully-functional common kitchen contains bar seating for up to 10 as well as a dining table and all necessary food prep and dining materials.  If you would like a room with a private bath, please contact us, additional rate will apply! This multi-unit residential space is situated above what was once the historic Windsor Button store. The space was last renovated in 2009. Located at 29-35 Temple Place in Downtown Crossing and in the heart of the Theatre District, guests here will find themselves within short walking distance to Boston’s Back Bay, Financial District, Chinatown and Beacon Hill. Historic sites like Boston Common and shopping on Newbury Street are right outside the door. The

Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing  - KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB - BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must
host_about:
We are a passionate team running a modern tech-enabled corp housing co that believes nicely furnished high end homes should be consistent, affordable and easy to book. 

All our homes are professionally managed, meeting the mark on being clean, well-stocked, having a more or less consistent look and feel, priced below a comparable hotel for an extended stay, and 24/7 SMS support by a virtual concierge team.

name: (S6) Suite Stay Downtown Boston!
summary: The Financial District is downtown’s business nerve center, crowded with stately banks, high-rise offices and sleek condos. Post Office Square, home to Norman B. Leventhal Park, offers a green respite with a lawn, sculptural fountain and garden trellises. Suited professionals frequent the district's chain eateries, lunch spots and high-end coffee shops. Swanky lounges and boisterous Irish pubs draw after-work crowds.
space: This space is priced better than neighboring hotel rooms and have the added bonus of a suite like layout! The space is roughly 900 sq ft, direct elevator access to your unit, Queen size bed, comfortable pullout couch with Apple TV and high speed Wifi! The unit does not have a kitchen but it does provide a small fridge/freezer, electric kettle, kurig coffee maker, microwave, wine glasses, drinking glasses, coffee mugs, and silverware. Enjoy the comfort of a luxury suite for a lower price and the convenience of an Airbnb. This unit is spectacular! Great for short stays and business stays!

host_about:
Hi there!
Thanks for looking into my profile . My name is Hasan. I work for a financial technology firm as a head of business development. As a side gig, I have been an airbnb host for 3 years managing 8 units in Boston and Cambridge. 

As you may have already seen, hotel prices are insanely expensive in Boston.  Thankfully, we are still able to offer affordable stays for those who are on a tight budget for their travel despite the fact that the city and hotel lobbies are cracking down on airbnb.

Why Do I host?
 I love the fact that people can still find affordable stays through Airbnb. When a family of 4 visits their daughter in May for graduation, they can book a place for $250/night instead of paying over $1000/night for a hotel stay. It means a lot to me! ( there was a time my parents could not come from overseas to visit me just because we could not afford their stay! ) 

My priority is to provide well located affordable stays to families and business travelers. I guarantee you that you will find a clean, well designed and conveniently located units with 24/7 assistance . 

However, if you have high standards, luxury buildings or jacuzzi tubs in the unit, my apartments may not be best option for you: Considering over $4000/month rents for a rundown building in Boston, I am not able to afford high end buildings to host guests on airbnb. You shall look for different options for your satisfactions. 

For others, I am more than happy to host you! Let's keep this community happy

Regards,
Hasan

name: Newly Renovated!  Queen's Cabin
summary: This place offers a perfect location with the value and camaraderie of a hostel, as well as the security, privacy, class, and cleanliness of an expensive hotel.  At this place, there are plenty of like-minded people to meet and set out with as you explore all the history and nightlife Boston has to offer. Remember to read the 'guest handbook' when you book to answer all your questions.
space: A word of caution, this is Downtown Boston so just like any prime location, it comes with noise at night!  With that said, being on the 4th vaulted floor, 100 feet above the streets, is higher up than most rentals in this area.  Anyway... My home is your home!  There are three traditionally styled guest bedrooms.   Queen's cabin features exposed brick, vaulted ceilings, a good amount of natural light, and a queen air mattress.  An innerspring mattress is available if you want but the air mattresses are comfier. This is an old office building converted into a rustic style loft apartment.  The building is full of friends who live in Boston and are avid travelers who love meeting people from all around the world.  Join us and explore Boston the right way!

neighborhood_overview: Located 4 minutes walk, smack dab in the middle of the Commons and the Hawbah :]
notes: NA
transit: There are many rail hubs in the area, one of the closest ones is the central hub of Boston called South Station which is a 3-minute walk.  There are super useful, affordable, and well maintained blue bike stations everywhere.  These bikes are even more useful in the city when it is not busy which is at night on weekdays and during the day on weekends.  Also, Lyft.  And by the way, you will be in the most walkable city in America!!
access: At this Airbnb, we have the entire floor to ourselves.  On this floor, there is a kitchen, lounge area, and two full bathrooms.
interaction: I am a software engineer who works a lot but does it from home so I am usually available for a good time.  I enjoy deep conversations, flying drones, scuba diving, paramotoring, and zipping from festival to festival on racing scooters.  Privacy and tranquility are paramount but if you are into it there is an epic party floor two floors down that we could visit.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house - 10pm - 8am quiet hours on weekdays
host_about: Usually just trying to relax.  People tell me they like having deep conversations with me and talking about stuff that matters.

summary: This place offers a perfect location with the value and camaraderie of a hostel, as well as the security, privacy, class, and cleanliness of an expensive hotel. name: Freedom Trail Bed 2
summary: This single twin bed is in a shared room with other solo AirBnB travelers and is located right in the downtown area.  Perfect for friends visiting other friends located at one of the many colleges in Boston.  If you've enjoyed staying at a hostel before for the economic value and ease of making new friends, then this is perfect for you.
space: The room is located on the upper floor of a recently renovated historic Boston building.  There is no lift.
description: This single twin bed is in a shared room with other solo AirBnB travelers and is located right in the downtown area.  Perfect for friends visiting other friends located at one of the many colleges in Boston.  If you've enjoyed staying at a hostel before for the economic value and ease of making new friends, then this is perfect for you. The room is located on the upper floor of a recently renovated historic Boston building.  There is no lift. Guests are welcome to come and go as they please, as long as it doesn't disturb other guests staying in the shared rooms.  There is no curfew.  Just be kind to others staying in your room.  There is no sharing beds. We would also like to note that the shared guest shower room is currently only open during the hours of 10a-6pm Monday through Saturday, and 11am-5pm on Sunday.  We are completing some remodeling additions that will fix this.  We offer two bathrooms with toilets and sinks to guest that are available 24/7.    Lastly, we provide a secure
neighborhood_overview: The heart of downtown Boston is right outside the front door.
notes: NA
transit: The Park Street Green Line T is only steps away, as well as the Orange Line, which is less than a minute walk away.  This location is ideal.
access: Guests are welcome to come and go as they please, as long as it doesn't disturb other guests staying in the shared rooms.  There is no curfew.  Just be kind to others staying in your room.  There is no sharing beds. We would also like to note that the shared guest shower room is currently only open during the hours of 10a-6pm Monday through Saturday, and 11am-5pm on Sunday.  We are completing some remodeling additions that will fix this.  We offer two bathrooms with toilets and sinks to guest that are available 24/7.    Lastly, we provide a secure locker for each bed, but please bring your own lock if you require locking your personal belongings.
interaction: We are always available to our guests for questions or suggestions on things to do in this great city.
house_rules: This is a soon to be hostel in Boston.  Please no sharing beds, smoking, vaping or drinking alcohol in the building.  This ain't that kind of place.  Please respect others belongs, as you'd want them to respect yours.  If you need to smoke cigarettes please do so outside and down the street away from the front door. The shower room is available during 10a-6p each day.  We are happy to provide you with a clean towel for free to use during your stay with us.
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm originally from Atlanta but have been living Boston in the famous the North End of Boston for the last 15 years.  Last summer I had the pleasure of AirBnB'ing in St. Petersburg Florida and I'm looking forward to continuing that here in Boston.  I owned and operated a hostel in downtown Boston for six years and I'm a big fan of hostels, so the spaces I rent are often shared.
.  
I love traveling, meeting travelers and helping them out with finding affordable accommodation where ever I am.  I'm opening another hostel soon and thought this would be a great way to continue what I like to do in the meantime.  Safe Travels!!

name: Upscale, cozy downtown Boston apartment
summary: We welcome you to enjoy our cozy, upscale, loft-style apartment located conveniently in downtown Boston, just 5 minutes from South Station.
space: NA
description: We welcome you to enjoy our cozy, upscale, loft-style apartment located conveniently in downtown Boston, just 5 minutes from South Station. Feel free to call or text us anytime and we will be close by to make your stay more comfortable. Boston Downtown is full of restaurants, bars, and shopping opportunities. Explore the Old State House, Faneuil Hall, The Freedom Trail, Boston Common and the Seaport District - all within walking distance from the apartment. Downtown Boston is quiet at night and safe to walk around any time of the day. Roche Brothers grocery store is within 5 minutes walking distance as well as a major CVS within South Station. Our apartment is conveniently located within 15 minutes drive from Boston Logan Airport, and 5 minutes walk from South Station. All major metro lines (Orange, Red, Green) are within 10 minutes walking distance.

host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

name: 604 - Affordable Accommodation Waiting For You!
summary: Temple Place Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our efficiency micro-apartments. At just 150 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices! This unit features carpet throughout, there is a a queen over XL full bed bunk bed, a separate wardrobe and dresser for hanging and storing clothes, plus comfortable seating. *This room is on the 6th floor, the elevator ONLY goes to the 5th floor. About 20 stairs required!*
space: The room comes with a bunk bed that has a full size bed over queen size bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4! This efficiency suite features a fully-equipped kitchenette and living area. The flooring is carpeted throughout, with ceramic tile in the bathroom. This unit has central heating and cooling that is controlled via a thermostat in the unit. The bed area features a queen over full bed, full-sized desk, reading lamp and USB alarm clock. The bathroom has a beautiful, white tile enclosed shower. The flat screen HD Smart TV (making watching programs like Netflix a snap) is equipped with local channels and HDMI inputs that can be used to connect a computer to view online content. Full stove/oven located outside of the unit.  All units are equipped with wireless internet, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, linens and towels, as well as a guest book with instructions and recommendations.  All building and unit doors are on secure, cod

neighborhood_overview: The Boston Common Park and Public Garden are only a few hundred feet away and Fenway Park is a quick 15 minutes away by train. Public transit by way of the Red, Orange and Green Subway lines is only a minute walk from the property. Grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minute walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Tuft’s Medical, Boston University, Emerson College and many other hospitals and schools are within 5-30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass College of Pharmacy, Suffolk, MIT, Harvard, Tufts, Tufts Dental, and more!
notes: *This room is on the 6th floor, the elevator ONLY goes to the 5th floor. About 20 stairs required!* When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Prefer a private bath? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!
interaction: You'll receive high quality towels and linens, coffee, shampoo and conditioner, an iron, ironing board, and hair dryer.
house_rules: House Rules You will be staying in a residential rental building with Airbnb guests and long term tenants so please abide by the following rules: -No smoking, smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside of the building.  -Please respect our neighbors by not having any additional guests.  -No parties, quiet hours begin at 9pm. -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the building. -Leave the room as you found it. -If you are a local, please do not instant book, contact us first. -Heat is controlled by the building so some rooms run warm!

name: Artists Loft Downtown Boston / Chinatown
summary: This open-format artists' loft is located in the very center of Boston (a 3-8 min walk from all main MBTA train lines), above one of Chinatown's most famous late-night restaurant destinations.  Once a noodle factory, the loft glows on sunny days  - with natural sunlight pouring in to highlight the dark wooden floors, industrial-style ceilings, and paintings throughout. Other unique features include a porcelain bathtub and an elevated queen bed with black-out curtains.
space: The loft is highly suitable for entertaining and cooking, with its large, open living space, lengthy kitchen island with vintage bar stools to enjoy for cocktail hours, and multiple couches for lounging.
